name: Paul Kagame
bio: Paul Kagame is the President of Rwanda, widely recognized for his leadership in transforming Rwanda post-genocide. He is known for his efforts in rebuilding the country's economy and ensuring social stability.
achievements: Led the post-genocide recovery in Rwanda.
Initiated the Vision 2020 program to transform Rwanda's economy.

name: Abiy Ahmed Ali
bio: Abiy Ahmed Ali, Prime Minister of Ethiopia, was awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for his role in ending the Eritrean-Ethiopian conflict. His reforms aim to modernize the Ethiopian economy and society.
achievements: Initiated economic and political reforms in Ethiopia.

name: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
bio: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is the Director-General of the World Trade Organization and a former Nigerian finance minister. Known for her economic expertise, she is a strong advocate for global economic reform.
achievements: First female and first African Director-General of the WTO.
Led Nigeriaâ€™s economic recovery efforts as Finance Minister.
